DataElement.preferredName: Urethra Neoplasm Malignant Neoplasm Endoscopy Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a malignant neoplasm of the urethra was found by endoscopy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Urethra Neoplasm Malignant Neoplasm Endoscopy Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of a tumor of the urethra, composed of atypical neoplastic often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues, determined by the use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer or tumors of the URETHRA. This condition is relatively uncommon and is the only cancer of the urinary system that has a higher incidence rate in females than males. Squamous cell carcinoma is the most frequent histologic type.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the urethra.  Urethral carcinoma is a representative example.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: (en-DAHS-ko-pee) The use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
